workflow.name: Automate Instagram stories publishing from Google Sheets with Meta Graph API
workflow.description:
# Automated Instagram Stories from Google Sheets

## üöÄ What it Does

This workflow **automates posting Instagram Stories** directly from a list of video URLs in a Google Sheet. Simply add a video link to the sheet, and this template will schedule and post it for you. It's designed to be a "set it and forget it" solution for your content strategy.

**Key Features:**

  * **Fully Automated:** Runs on a schedule to post new content without manual intervention.
  * **Simple Content Management:** Manage your entire video queue from one Google Sheet.
  * **Smart & Safe:** Automatically avoids posting duplicate content by tracking what has already been published.
  * **Randomized Posting:** Shuffles the video list to ensure varied content is posted, not just the first one on the list.

-----

## üìã Pre-Setup Requirements

Before you start, you'll need a few things. This is the most important part of the setup\!

1.  **Instagram Business Account:** A personal account won't work. It must be a Business or Creator account.
2.  **Facebook Page:** Your Instagram Business Account must be connected to a Facebook Page.
3.  **Meta Developer Account:** This is required to create an "App" that gives n8n permission to post on your behalf.
4.  **A Publicly Accessible Place to Host Videos:** This is critical. The video URLs you use must be direct links to the video file.
      * ‚úÖ **Good Sources:** Shopify file storage, Amazon S3, a WordPress site with a valid SSL certificate (`https://...`).
      * ‚ùå **Unreliable Sources:** Google Drive and Dropbox share links **will not work** because they are not direct links to the video file itself.

-----

## ‚öôÔ∏è Step-by-Step Setup Guide

Follow these three parts carefully. Once done, you won't have to touch the configuration again.

### Part 1: Meta (Facebook/Instagram) Configuration

This section generates the keys and IDs you need to allow n8n to communicate with Instagram.

1.  **Create a Meta App:**

      * Go to [Meta for Developers](https://developers.facebook.com/) and create a new app.
      * **Detailed Guide:** [Meta's Official Guide to Creating an App](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/development/create-an-app/)

2.  **Configure App Permissions:**

      * In your new app's dashboard, add the "**Instagram Graph API**" product.
      * Under "Permissions," you will need to grant `instagram_basic`, `instagram_content_publish`, `pages_show_list`, and `pages_read_engagement`.

3.  **Find Your Instagram Business Account ID:**

      * You'll need this ID for the workflow.
3.1. **Log in:** to your Instagram account.  
3.2. **Click on your Profile:** in the menu on the left.  
3.3. **Click:** "Edit Profile" at the top.  
3.4. Under the **"Settings"** heading, click **"See more in Accounts Center"**.  
3.5. **Select:** your intended Instagram profile.  
3.6. In the URL, your Instagram Business Account ID will be displayed after `/profiles` in a numerical format.  

   **Example:**  
   `https://accountscenter.instagram.com/profiles/[YOUR_ID]/?theme=dark`


4.  **Generate a Long-Lived Access Token:**

      * An access token is like a password for n8n to use. A standard one expires quickly, so you need a long-lived one.
      * **Official Guide:** [Meta's Guide to Generating a Long-Lived Token](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login/guides/access-tokens/get-long-lived/)

-----

### Part 2: Google Sheet Preparation

This is where you'll manage your video content.

1.  **Create a Google Sheet:** You can make a new one or use our template to get started quickly.
      * **Download Template:** [Instagram Videos Template.xlsx](https://imanetworks.ch/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Instagram-Videos-Template.xlsx)
2.  **Set Up Columns:** Your sheet **must** have these two columns with these exact names:
      * `source_url`: This is where you will paste the direct URL to your video file.
      * `posted_story`: Leave this column **empty**. The workflow will automatically fill it with `true` after a video is successfully posted.
3.  **Get the Sheet ID:** In your Google Sheet URL, copy the long string of letters and numbers from the middle:
    `https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/`**`[THIS_IS_THE_SHEET_ID]`**`/edit`

-----

### Part 3: n8n Workflow Configuration

Now, let's connect everything inside your n8n workflow.

1.  **Fill the `‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Hub` Node:**

      * **IG\_BUSINESS\_ID:** Paste the Instagram ID you found in Part 1.
      * **SHEET\_DOC\_ID:** Paste the Google Sheet ID you found in Part 2.
      * **SHEET\_TAB\_NAME:** Enter the exact name of the tab in your Google Sheet (e.g., "Instagram Videos").

2.  **Connect Your Credentials:**

      * **Google Sheets:** In the `üìä Fetch Videos from Sheet` node, create a new credential and connect your Google Account.
      * **Facebook Graph API:** In the `üì§ Create Story Container` node, create a new credential. Use the **App ID**, **App Secret**, and the **Long-Lived Access Token** you generated in Part 1. You will use this same credential for the other Facebook/Instagram nodes.

3.  **Activate the Workflow:**

      * First, test it by clicking the "Execute Workflow" button on the `üöÄ Manual Start` node.
      * Once you confirm it works, **activate the workflow** using the toggle at the top of the screen. The `‚è∞ Auto Schedule` node is set to run daily by default, but you can change the time to whatever you like.

-----

## ü§î Troubleshooting

  * **Error: "(\#10) This endpoint requires the 'instagram\_content\_publish' permission"**: Your Meta App is missing the correct permissions. Go back to the app settings in the Meta Developer dashboard and add it.
  * **Error: "Unsupported post request" or Video Processing Fails**: This is almost always an issue with the video URL. Ensure it's a **direct link** and not from a service like Google Drive. Paste the URL into your browser‚Äîit should immediately start playing the video, not take you to a preview page.
  * **Error: "Sheet not found"**: Double-check that your `SHEET_DOC_ID` and `SHEET_TAB_NAME` in the Config node are perfectly correct (it's case-sensitive\!).
  * **Workflow runs but doesn't post**: Make sure you have rows in your Google Sheet where the `posted_story` column is empty. If all are marked `true`, it has nothing new to post.

@iMan https://imanetworks.ch/

parameters.content:
üé¨ **Instagram Story Automation Template**

**What this does:** Automatically posts Instagram Stories from videos listed in a Google Sheet.

**Quick Setup (5 minutes):**
1Ô∏è‚É£ Configure the ‚öôÔ∏è Config node with your Instagram Business ID and Sheet details
2Ô∏è‚É£ Connect your Google Sheets and Facebook Graph API credentials
You can download my template here:
https://imanetworks.ch/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Instagram-Videos-Template.xlsx

3Ô∏è‚É£ Add video URLs to your Google Sheet
4Ô∏è‚É£ Test with Manual Trigger, then enable Schedule

**For Non-Technical Users:**
‚Ä¢ You only need to edit the ‚öôÔ∏è Config node once
‚Ä¢ After setup, just add videos to your Google Sheet
‚Ä¢ The workflow handles everything automatically

**Need Help?** Check the troubleshooting section below!

nodes.name: ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Hub
nodes.notes:
üîß **SETUP REQUIRED** - Replace these values:

‚Ä¢ **IG_BUSINESS_ID**: Your Instagram Business Account ID
  ‚Üí Find in Facebook Business Manager > Instagram Accounts
  ‚Üí It's a long number (e.g., 17841450311185426)

‚Ä¢ **GRAPH_VERSION**: Facebook API version (usually v21.0 or newer)
  ‚Üí Check https://developers.facebook.com/docs/graph-api

‚Ä¢ **SHEET_DOC_ID**: Your Google Sheet ID from the URL
  ‚Üí Copy from: docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/[THIS_PART]/edit

‚Ä¢ **SHEET_TAB_NAME**: The exact name of your sheet tab
  ‚Üí Default: "Instagram Videos" (case-sensitive)

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important**: Only change these values once during setup!

assignments.name: SHEET_DOC_ID
assignments.value: Google Sheet ID (you can see it in the url of your sheet)

nodes.name: üöÄ Manual Start
nodes.notes:
üéØ **FOR TESTING**

Click the ‚ñ∂Ô∏è button to test your workflow immediately.

**When to use:**
‚Ä¢ First-time setup testing
‚Ä¢ Checking if credentials work
‚Ä¢ Testing new videos before scheduling

**Non-technical tip**: Always test manually before enabling the schedule!

nodes.name: ‚è∞ Auto Schedule
nodes.notes:
üïê **AUTOMATIC POSTING**

Currently set to run daily at 8:30 PM.

**To change the time:**
1. Click this node
2. Adjust 'triggerAtHour' (0-23, where 20 = 8 PM)
3. Adjust 'triggerAtMinute' (0-59)

**Examples:**
‚Ä¢ 9:00 AM = Hour: 9, Minute: 0
‚Ä¢ 2:30 PM = Hour: 14, Minute: 30
‚Ä¢ 11:45 PM = Hour: 23, Minute: 45

**Tip**: Choose times when your audience is most active!

parameters.content:
üìã **Google Sheet Format Requirements**

**Required Columns:**
‚Ä¢ **Path** ‚Üí Direct video URL (must be publicly accessible)
‚Ä¢ **Posted** ‚Üí Leave empty for new videos

**Video Requirements:**
‚Ä¢ Format: MP4
‚Ä¢ Max duration: 60 seconds
‚Ä¢ Aspect ratio: 9:16 (vertical) recommended
‚Ä¢ Max file size: 4GB
‚Ä¢ URL must not require login/authentication

**Example Row:**
| Path | Posted |
|------|--------|
| https://example.com/video.mp4 | |

**After posting, 'Posted' will show 'true'**

nodes.name: üìä Fetch Videos from Sheet
nodes.notes:
üì• **CREDENTIAL SETUP REQUIRED**

**What it does:** Reads all videos from your Google Sheet

**Setup Steps:**
1. Click the 'Credential for Google Sheets' dropdown
2. Select 'Create New Credential'
3. Choose 'Google Sheets OAuth2 API'
4. Click 'Connect my account' and sign in
5. Grant permissions to access your sheets

**Troubleshooting:**
‚Ä¢ Error 403: Check sheet sharing permissions
‚Ä¢ 'Sheet not found': Verify SHEET_TAB_NAME in Config
‚Ä¢ No data: Ensure sheet has headers 'Path' and 'Posted'

nodes.name: üé≤ Randomize Order
nodes.notes:
üîÄ **SMART SELECTION**

**What it does:** Shuffles your video list randomly

**Why this helps:**
‚Ä¢ Prevents always posting the first video
‚Ä¢ Creates variety in your content schedule
‚Ä¢ Ensures fair rotation of all videos

**No setup needed** - this works automatically!

**Note:** The workflow will still skip videos already marked as 'Posted'

nodes.name: üîÑ Process Each Video
nodes.notes:
üîç **VIDEO PROCESSOR**

**What it does:** Checks each video one by one to find unposted content

**How it works:**
1. Takes the shuffled list
2. Examines each video's 'Posted' status
3. Finds the first video that hasn't been posted
4. Processes only that video

**No configuration needed** - this is automatic!

**Result:** Only posts one new video per run

nodes.name: ‚ùì Already Posted Check
nodes.notes:
üö¶ **SMART FILTER**

**What it does:** Checks if this video was already posted

**Logic:**
‚Ä¢ **If Posted = 'true'** ‚Üí Skip this video, check next one
‚Ä¢ **If Posted is empty/false** ‚Üí Continue to post this video

**Why this matters:**
‚Ä¢ Prevents duplicate posts
‚Ä¢ Automatically tracks what's been shared
‚Ä¢ Saves you from manual tracking

**No setup needed** - works automatically!

nodes.name: üéØ Prepare Video Data
nodes.notes:
üìã **DATA PREPARATION**

**What it does:** Organizes the video information for Instagram

**Variables created:**
‚Ä¢ **instagram_business_id**: Your Instagram account ID
‚Ä¢ **video_url**: The video file location
‚Ä¢ **api_version**: Facebook API version to use

**Why this step:** Makes the data clean and ready for Instagram's API

**No configuration needed** - uses values from your Config node automatically!

parameters.content:
üì± **Instagram Story Requirements**

**Video Specs:**
‚Ä¢ Format: MP4, MOV
‚Ä¢ Duration: 1-60 seconds
‚Ä¢ Resolution: 1080x1920 (9:16 ratio)
‚Ä¢ Max file size: 4GB
‚Ä¢ Frame rate: 30 fps max

**URL Requirements:**
‚Ä¢ Must be publicly accessible
‚Ä¢ No login/password required
‚Ä¢ HTTPS recommended
‚Ä¢ Direct link to video file

**Common Issues:**
‚Ä¢ Google Drive/Dropbox share links won't work
‚Ä¢ Password-protected videos will fail
‚Ä¢ Very large files may timeout

**Tip:** Test your URL in a browser first!

nodes.name: üì§ Create Story Container
nodes.notes:
üèóÔ∏è **CREDENTIAL SETUP REQUIRED**

**What it does:** Creates an Instagram Story container (not published yet)

**Setup Steps:**
1. Click 'Credential for Facebook Graph API'
2. Select 'Create New Credential'
3. Enter your Facebook App credentials:
   ‚Ä¢ App ID (from Facebook Developers)
   ‚Ä¢ App Secret (from Facebook Developers)
4. Grant Instagram permissions

**What happens:** Instagram downloads and processes your video

**Result:** Returns a container ID for the next step

nodes.name: üîç Check Processing Status
nodes.notes:
‚è≥ **STATUS MONITOR**

**What it does:** Checks if Instagram finished processing your video

**Possible statuses:**
‚Ä¢ **IN_PROGRESS**: Still processing (wait more)
‚Ä¢ **FINISHED**: Ready to publish ‚úÖ
‚Ä¢ **ERROR**: Something went wrong ‚ùå

**Why this step:** Instagram needs time to encode/validate your video

**No configuration needed** - uses the same Facebook credentials as previous step

nodes.name: ‚úÖ Ready to Publish?
nodes.notes:
üö¶ **PUBLISH GATE**

**What it checks:** Is the video ready for publishing?

**Two paths:**
‚Ä¢ **TRUE (status = FINISHED)** ‚Üí Proceed to publish
‚Ä¢ **FALSE (still processing)** ‚Üí Wait 30 seconds and check again

**Why this matters:**
‚Ä¢ Publishing too early = failure
‚Ä¢ This ensures your video is properly processed

**Automatic loop:** Will keep checking until ready or timeout

nodes.name: ‚è∞ Wait 30 Seconds
nodes.notes:
‚è∏Ô∏è **PATIENCE IS KEY**

**What it does:** Waits 30 seconds before checking status again

**Why 30 seconds:**
‚Ä¢ Gives Instagram time to process
‚Ä¢ Prevents overwhelming their servers
‚Ä¢ Most videos process within 1-3 minutes

**Adjustable:** You can change the wait time if needed
‚Ä¢ Smaller videos: 15-20 seconds
‚Ä¢ Larger videos: 45-60 seconds

**Note:** The workflow will loop until processing is complete

nodes.name: üéâ Publish to Instagram
nodes.notes:
üöÄ **THE MOMENT OF TRUTH**

**What it does:** Publishes your video as an Instagram Story

**This step:**
‚Ä¢ Takes the processed video container
‚Ä¢ Makes it live on your Instagram account
‚Ä¢ Your followers can now see the story

**Success indicators:**
‚Ä¢ Returns a media ID
‚Ä¢ No error messages
‚Ä¢ Story appears on your Instagram profile

**Uses the same Facebook credentials** as previous steps

nodes.name: ‚úèÔ∏è Mark as Posted
nodes.notes:
üìù **RECORD KEEPING**

**What it does:** Updates your Google Sheet to mark this video as posted

**How it works:**
1. Finds the row with the matching video URL
2. Sets the 'Posted' column to 'true'
3. Prevents the same video from being posted again

**Why this matters:**
‚Ä¢ Automatic tracking
‚Ä¢ No duplicate posts
‚Ä¢ Clear record of what's been shared

**Uses the same Google Sheets credentials** as the fetch step

parameters.content:
üö® **Troubleshooting Guide**

**Common Issues:**

**1. Workflow stops at processing:**
‚Ä¢ Video URL not accessible publicly
‚Ä¢ Video doesn't meet Instagram requirements
‚Ä¢ Check video format (MP4 recommended)

**2. 'Sheet not found' error:**
‚Ä¢ Verify SHEET_DOC_ID in Config
‚Ä¢ Check SHEET_TAB_NAME spelling (case-sensitive)
‚Ä¢ Ensure sheet is accessible to your Google account

**3. Facebook API errors:**
‚Ä¢ Verify Instagram Business Account connection
‚Ä¢ Check app permissions in Facebook Developers
‚Ä¢ Ensure account has Instagram Content Publishing permission

**4. Posted column not updating:**
‚Ä¢ Confirm Path values are unique in sheet
‚Ä¢ Check Google Sheets permissions
‚Ä¢ Verify credential connections

**Need more help?** Check n8n community forums or documentation.

üéì **Setup Checklist for Non-Technical Users**

**Before you start:**
‚òê Instagram Business Account (not personal)
‚òê Facebook Business Manager access
‚òê Google account with Sheets access
‚òê Videos in MP4 format, publicly hosted

**Required Credentials:**
‚òê Facebook Developer App (free)
‚òê Google Sheets OAuth connection
‚òê Instagram Business Account linked to Facebook

**One-time setup:**
‚òê Replace values in ‚öôÔ∏è Configuration Hub
‚òê Connect Facebook Graph API credential
‚òê Connect Google Sheets credential
‚òê Test with Manual Trigger
‚òê Enable Schedule Trigger

**Ongoing usage:**
‚òê Add video URLs to Google Sheet
‚òê Leave 'Posted' column empty for new videos
‚òê Check Instagram for posted stories

**That's it! The workflow handles everything else automatically.**

user.name: iMan
user.bio: My name is Iman Sadeghizadeh, and I am an experienced IT Specialist. I believe in leveraging technology to drive innovation and efficiency. My approach to IT consulting is collaborative, aiming to understand the unique needs of each client and tailor solutions that are both effective and sustainable. I am committed to staying abreast of the latest industry trends and continuously enhancing my skills to provide the best possible service.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
